entry.title: Comparing HDD and SSD
entry.content:
The other day my SSD finally arrived. Immediately, I removed the standard 320 GB HDD that had been in my 13″ MacBook Pro since day one (Western Digital WD3200BEVT) and replaced it with my brand new 60GB OCZ Vertex 2 Series OCZSSD2-2VTXE60G SSD. Of course, the enormous boost in speed is obvious. But I wanted numbers – facts!

So I ran a couple of UNIX commands under Mac OS X Snow Leopard (10.6.4).

Turns out, the SSD is five to seven (!!!) times as fast as the good old HDD:

Commands I used:

Writing a ~5 GB file time dd if=/dev/zero of=/Users/timsteinbach/blubb2 bs=1024000 count=5000

Reading that ~5 GB file time dd of=/dev/zero if=/Users/timsteinbach/blubb2 bs=1024000 count=5000

Results HDD:
(38499108 bytes/sec) (~41 MB/s) for writing
(42803917 bytes/sec) (~37 MB/s) for reading

Results SSD:
(207697193 bytes/sec) (~198 MB/s) for writing
(280832960 bytes/sec) (~268 MB/s) for reading
